intro: Andreettaea infinita, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
